c74object.name: crossfade~
c74object.description: The `crossfade~` object implements a dynamic crossfading algorithm between two input signals based on a control signal. It uses a ramping mechanism that adjusts its length based on the signal amplitude, allowing for smoother or faster transitions depending on the content.

inlet.description: A change in this signal triggers a crossfade. If it increases, it fades towards signal 2. If it decreases, it fades towards signal 1.
The first input signal to be crossfaded.
The second input signal to be crossfaded.

outlet.description: The processed version of Source 1 (multiplied by its fader).
The processed version of Source 2 (multiplied by its fader).
The sum of Mix 1 and Mix 2.
Outputs 1.0 while a crossfade is in progress, and 0.0 when finished.

attribute.name: low
attribute.description: The minimum length of the crossfade ramp in milliseconds. Defaults to 22.653 ms (approx 999 samples at 44.1kHz).

attribute.name: high
attribute.description: The maximum length of the crossfade ramp in milliseconds. Defaults to 4999.0 ms.

attribute.name: log
attribute.description: When enabled (1), creates an additional outlet for status information.
